summary: The 'Energy Freedom Act' aims to repeal numerous green energy tax subsidies within the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The bill specifically targets tax credits related to energy-efficient home improvements, renewable energy, clean vehicles, and various other clean energy initiatives. It includes corresponding amendments to other sections of the code and specifies effective dates, primarily applying to tax years beginning after December 31, 2025. It also repeals the tax on petroleum and sections related to elective payment for energy property and electricity from renewable resources.
